title:
[Original impression]: Preclarissimum opus elementorum Euclidis megarensis vna cum commentis Campani perspicacissimi in artem geometriam incipit feliciter.
[Re-set]: Preclarissimus liber elementorum Euclidis perspicacissimi: in artem Geometrie incipit quamfoelicissime:
colophon: Opus elementorum euclidis megarensis in geometriam artem In id quoque Campani perspicacissimi Commentationes finiunt. Erhardus ratdolt Augustensis impressor solertissimus. venetijs impres-sit. Anno salutis. M.cccc.lxxxij. Octauis. Calen. Iun. Lector. Vale.
title_EN:
[Original impression]: The most illustrious work of the elements of Euclid of Megara, together with the very perceptive commentaries of Campanus on the art of geometry, begins happily.
[Re-set]: The most illustrious book of the very perceptive Euclid's elements: on the art of Geometry begins most happily:
colophon_EN: The work of Euclid of Megara on the art of geometry, in which also the most perceptive commentaries of Campanus conclude. Erhard Ratdolt of Augsburg, a most skillful printer, printed in Venice. In the year of salvation 1482, on the eighth day before the Calends of June. Reader, farewell.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: in artem geometriam incipit feliciter.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC 2: in artem Geometrie incipit quamfoelicissime:
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: vna cum commentis Campani perspicacissimi

title:
[Part 1]: Haec sunt opera Boetii: quae in hoc volumine continentur.
[Part 2]: Incipit tabula super libris Boetij de consolatione philo-sophiae secundum ordinem alphabeti.
colophon:
[Part 1] Uenetijs Impressum Boetij opus per Joannem et Gregorium de gregorijs fratres foelici exitu ad finem vsque perductum accuratissimeque emendatum Anno humane restaurationis. 1492. die.
18. Augusti. Augustino Barbadico Serenissimo Uenetiarum principe Rem pu. tenente.
[Part 2] Diui. Seuerini Boetij de consolatione: necnon de scolarium disciplina mellifluis operibus: cum sancti Thomae super vtroque commentarijs: in hoc eodem volumine. Jmpressis venetijs per Joannem de Forliuio et Gregorium fratres. Anno salutis. M.cccc.lxxxxj. die. xxvj. mensis Martij.
title_EN:
[Part 1]: These are the works of Boethius: which are contained in this volume.
[Part 2]: Here begins the table on the books of Boethius on the consolation of philosophy according to the order of the alphabet.
colophon_EN:
[Part 1] The work of Boethius, "Uenetijs Impressum," brought to completion with a happy outcome by the brothers Joannes and Gregorius de Gregorijs, most accurately corrected in the year of human restoration, 1492, on the 18th day of August, under the most serene prince of Venice, Augustinus Barbadicus, holding the public office.

[Part 2] The divine works of Severinus Boethius on consolation, as well as on the discipline of scholars, with the commentaries of Saint Thomas on both, in this same volume. Printed in Venice by Joannes de Forlivio and the brothers Gregorius in the year of salvation, 1491, on the 26th day of the month of March.

title: Preclarissimus liber elementorum Euclidis perspicacissimi: in artem Geometrie incipit quamfœlicissime:
colophon: Opus elementorum euclidis megarensis in geometriam artem In id quoque Campani perspicacissimi Commentationes fini-unt. Impresum Vincentiæ per Magistrum Leonardum de Basilea & Gulielmum de Papia Socios. Anno salutis M.cccclxxxxi. Vigesimo. Calen. Iunius. Lector. Vale.
title_EN: The most illustrious book of Euclid's most perceptive elements: in the art of Geometry begins most happily:
colophon_EN: The work of Euclid of Megara on the art of geometry is concluded with the very insightful Commentaries of Campanus. Printed in Vicenza by Master Leonard of Basel & William of Pavia, Partners. In the year of salvation 1491. On the twentieth of the Calends of June. Reader. Farewell.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: in artem Geometrie incipit quamfœlicissime

title:
Georgio Valla Placentino Interprete. Hoc in volumine hec con-tinentur. Nicephori logica[.] Georgij valle libellus de argumentis[.] Euclidis quartus decimus elementorum.  Hypsiclis interpretatio
eiusdem libri euclidis [etc]
colophon:
[Part 1: None.]
[Part 2] Venetiis. Impressum Boetii opus per Ioannem et Grego-rium de gregoriis fratres felici exitu ad finem vsque perductum accu-ratissimeque emendatum Anno humane restaurationis. 1499. die. 8. Julii. Augustino Barbadico Serenissimo Uenetiarum principe Rempu. tenente.
[Part 3] Adest finis Diui. Seuerini Boetii de consolatione. necnon de scolarium disciplina mellifluis operibus cum sancti Tome super vtroque commentariis. in hoc eodem volumine. Impressis venetiis per Ioannem de Forliuio et Gregorium fratres Anno salutis. Mcccclxxxxvii die. x. februarii.
title_EN: Georgio Valla Placentino Interpreter. This volume contains the following. Nicephorus' Logic[.] Georgio Valla's booklet on arguments[.] Euclid's fourteenth book of Elements. Hypsicles' interpretation of the same book of Euclid [etc]
colophon_EN:
[Part 1: None.]
[Part 2] In Venice. The work of Boethius was printed by Ioannes and Gregorius de Gregoriis, brothers, brought to a successful conclusion and most accurately corrected in the Year of Human Restoration, 1499, on the 8th day of July, with Augustino Barbadico, the Most Serene Prince of Venice, holding the Republic.
[Part 3] Here ends the divine work of Severinus Boethius on consolation, as well as on the discipline of scholars, with the mellifluous works and the commentaries of Saint Thomas on both, printed in this same volume in Venice by Ioannes de Forlivio and the brothers Gregorius in the Year of Salvation, 1497, on the 10th day of February.
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: Nicephori logica
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT 2: Hypsiclis interpretatio eiusdem libri euclidis

colophon: Impressum Parisii in pago diui Jacobi ad insigne sancti Georgii Anno christi siderum conditoris 1500 prima septembris Per impressorem vvolgangum hopylium Cui hec sententia semper firma mente sedet: Non viribus aut velocitatibus aut celeritate corporum res magne geruntur: sed Consilio, Sententia, et auctoritate.
title_EN: Text of "De Sphera" by Johannes de Sacrobosco With additions (as much as necessary) appended: A new commentary recently published For the benefit of students of Philosophy at the University of Paris. Illustrated with the Composition of the Astronomical Ring by Bonetus Latensis. And the Geometry of Euclid of Megara.
colophon_EN: Published in Paris in the district of Saint James at the sign of Saint George in the year of Christ the creator of the stars 1500 on the first of September by the printer Wolfgang Hopyl to whom this maxim always firmly adheres in mind: Great things are not accomplished by strength or speed or swiftness of body, but by counsel, judgment, and authority.

title: Euclidis megarensis philosophi platonicj Mathematicarum disci-plinarum Ianitoris: Habent in hoc volumine quicumque ad mathemat-icam substantiam aspirant: elementorum libros. xiij. cum expositione Theonis insignis mathematici. quibus multa quae deerant ex lectione graeca sumpta addita sub nec non plurima subuersa et prepostere: voluta in Campani interpretatione: ordinata digesta et castigata sunt. Quibus etiam nonnulla ab illo venerando. Socratico philosopho mirando iudicio structa habentur adiuncta. Deputatum scilicet Euclidi volumen. xiiij. cum expositione Hypsi. Alex. Itidemque et Phaeno. Specu. et Perspe. cum expositione Theonis. ac mirandus ille liber Datorum cum expositione Pappi Mechanici vna cum Marini dialectici protheoria. Bar. Zamber. Vene. Interprete. Cum grat¯ıa et Priuilegio per decennium.
colophon: Impressum Venetiis fœlicibus auibus opus est huiusmodi aureum & rarissimum: in aedibus Ioannis Tacuini librarii accuratissima dilligentia recognitum. Anno reconciliatæ diuinitatis. M.D.V. VIII. Klendas nouembris. Auspiciis fœlicissimæ Venetorum. Re. Pu. Leor-nadi Lauretani: Principis sapientissimi: Cautum est tamen dominii sanctione: ne quis presens opus Venetiis cudat: aut alibi impressum uendere audeat: mulcta adiuncta ut in Priui. pressius legitur.
title_EN: Euclid of Megara, a Platonic philosopher, the gatekeeper of mathematical disciplines: In this volume, those who aspire to the substance of mathematics will find: thirteen books of the Elements, with the exposition of Theon, a distinguished mathematician. Many things that were missing have been added, taken from the Greek reading, and not a few have been overturned and improperly handled in Campanus's interpretation; they have been arranged, organized, and corrected. To these are also added some things constructed by that venerable Socratic philosopher with admirable judgment. Namely, the fourteenth book attributed to Euclid, with the exposition of Hypsicles of Alexandria. Likewise, Phaenomena, Optics, and Catoptrics with the exposition of Theon, and that marvelous book of Data with the exposition of Pappus the Mechanic, together with the protheoria of Marinus the Dialectician. Bartholomew Zamberti of Venice, Interpreter. With grace and privilege for a decade.
colophon_EN: Impressum in Venice under fortunate auspices, this work is golden and most rare: in the house of Giovanni Tacuino, bookseller, reviewed with the most accurate diligence. In the year of reconciled divinity. 1505. On the eighth day before the Kalends of November. Under the auspices of the most fortunate Republic of Venice. Of Leonardo Loredan: the most wise prince: It is nevertheless decreed by the sanction of the dominion: that no one may print this work in Venice: or dare to sell it printed elsewhere: under penalty as more precisely read in the Privilege.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: Habent in hoc volumine quicumque ad mathemat-icam substantiam aspirant: elementorum libros. xiij. cum expositione Theonis insignis mathematici.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC 2: quibus multa quae deerant ex lectione graeca sumpta addita sub nec non plurima subuersa et prepostere: voluta in Campani interpretatione: ordinata digesta et castigata sunt.
TITLE: EDITION INFO: ordinata digesta et castigata sunt.
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: Deputatum scilicet Euclidi volumen. xiiij. cum expositione Hypsi. Alex. Itidemque et Phaeno. Specu. et Perspe. cum expositione Theonis. ac mirandus ille liber Datorum cum expositione Pappi Mechanici vna cum Marini dialectici protheoria.
TITLE: PRIVILEGES: Cum grat¯ıa et Priuilegio per decennium.
TITLE: VERBS: sumpta, addita, subuersa, voluta, ordinata, digesta, castigata
OTHER NAMES: Theonis insignis mathematici, Campani, Hypsi. Alex., Phaeno, Pappi Mechanici, Marini dialectici

title: Preclarissimus liber elementorum Euclidis perspicacissimi. in artem Geometrie incipit quamfoelicissime
colophon: Et tantum de quatuor libris elementorum Euclidis cum fa-miliari Campani in eosdem comentario. qui cum in omnibus vniuer-salibus studijs ordinaria institucione preeleguntur sic eciam in hac nos-tra achademia franckfordiana. ab illustrissimis Ioachim principe elec-tore et Alberto germanj marchionibus Brandeburgj nuper erecta. per Mgrm Ambrosium lacher de Merspurg mathematicum ibidemque Colle-giatum accurata diligencia lecti castigati propriisque impensis elaborati sunt atque impressi ut athenarum more studium philosophie a mathe-matico splendore mirifice inceptum efflorescat Anno salutis. vi.
title_EN: The most illustrious book of the elements of the most perceptive Euclid. in the art of Geometry begins most happily
colophon_EN: And so much from the four books of Euclid's Elements with the familiar commentary of Campanus on the same. which, as they are ordinarily preferred in all universal studies, so also in this our Frankfort academy. recently established by the most illustrious Joachim, prince elector, and Albert, margraves of Brandenburg. by Master Ambrosius Lacher of Merspurg, mathematician and fellow there, they have been read with accurate diligence, corrected, and elaborated at their own expense and printed so that, in the manner of Athens, the study of philosophy wonderfully begun may flourish from the mathematical splendor. In the year of salvation. vi.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: in artem Geometrie incipit quamfoelicissime

title:
Euclidis megarensis philosophi acutissimi mathematicorumque omnium sine controuersia principis opera a Campano interprete fidissimo tralata Que cum antea librariorum detestanda culpa mendis fedissimis adeo deformia essent: vt vix Euclidem ipsum agnoscere-mus. Lucas paciolus theologus insignis: altissima Mathematicarum disciplinarum scientia rarissimus iudicio castigatissimo detersit: emen-dauit. Figuras centum et vndetriginta que in alijs codicibus inuerse et deformate erant: ad rectam symmetriam concinnauit: et multas necessarias addidit. Eundem quoque plurimis locis intellectu diicilem commentariolis sane luculentis et eruditiss. aperuit: enarrauit: illustrauit Adhec vt elimatior exiret Scipio vegius mediol. vir vtraque lingua: arte medica: sublimioribusque studijs clarissimus diligentiam: et censuram
suam prestitit.
colophon:
Euclidis megarensis philosophi perspicacissimi elemen-torum opus de duabus quantitatibus discreta scilicet et continua. ac earundem proportionibus et proportionalitatibus: ex optima Campani interpretatione. Magistro Luca paciolo de Burgo Sancti Sepulchri Ordinis Minorum sacre theologie professore. Matematiceque discipline cultore feruentissimo die noctuque chalcographis asistente postillis suis oportunis plerisque in locis additis manu propria accuratissime castigatum finit.
Venetiis impressum per probum Virum Paganinum de Paganinis de Brixia decreto tamen publico vt nullus ibidem totique dominio annorum .xv. curriculo imprimat aut imprimere faciat. et alibi impres-sum sub quouis colore in publicum ducat sub penis in dicto priuilegio contentis Anno redemptionis nostre .M.D.VIIII. Klen .XI. Iunii. Leonardo Lauretano Ve. Re. Pu. Gubernante. Pontificatus Iulii .II. Anno .VI.
imprint: A. Paganius Paganinus Characteribus elegantissimis accu-ratissime imprimebat.
title_EN: The works of Euclid of Megara, the most acute philosopher and without controversy the prince of all mathematicians, translated by Campanus, the most faithful interpreter. These works, which previously, due to the deplorable fault of scribes, were so deformed by the most foul errors that we could scarcely recognize Euclid himself. Lucas Pacioli, a distinguished theologian, exceedingly rare in the highest knowledge of mathematical disciplines, with the most discerning judgment, cleansed and corrected them. He arranged one hundred and thirty-nine figures, which in other manuscripts were inverted and deformed, into correct symmetry and added many necessary ones. In many places, he also elucidated, explained, and illustrated the same work, which was difficult to understand, with very clear and most learned commentaries. Moreover, so that it might emerge more refined, Scipio Vegius of Milan, a man renowned in both languages, the medical art, and higher studies, provided his diligence and critique.
colophon_EN:
The work of the most perceptive philosopher Euclid of Megara on the elements concerning two quantities, namely discrete and continuous, and their proportions and proportionalities: from the best interpretation of Campanus. By Master Luca Pacioli of Borgo San Sepolcro, a professor of sacred theology of the Order of Friars Minor, and a most fervent devotee of the mathematical discipline, assisting the printers day and night, with his own hand most accurately corrected, with his appropriate annotations added in many places.

Printed in Venice by the honorable man Paganinus de Paganinis of Brescia, yet by public decree that no one there or in the entire dominion for the course of fifteen years may print or cause to be printed, and that it may not be brought into public elsewhere under any pretext, under the penalties contained in the said privilege. In the year of our redemption 1509, the eleventh day of June, under the governance of Leonardo Loredan, Doge of the Venetian Republic. In the sixth year of the pontificate of Julius II.
imprint_EN: A. Paganius Paganinus was printing with the most elegant characters very accurately.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: Euclidis megarensis philosophi acutissimi mathematicorumque omnium sine controuersia principis opera

TITLE: CONTENT DESC 2: Que cum antea librariorum detestanda culpa mendis fedissimis adeo deformia essent: vt vix Euclidem ipsum agnoscere-mus.
TITLE: AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: altissima Mathematicarum disciplinarum scientia rarissimus iudicio castigatissimo detersit: emen-dauit.

title:
Euclidis Megarensis philosophi platonicj Mathematicarum disci-plinarum Ianitoris: Habent in hoc volumine quicumque ad mathemat-
icam substantiam aspirant: elementorum libros. xiij. cum expositione Theonis insignis mathematici. quibus multa quae deerant ex lectione graeca sumpta addita sub nec non plurima subuersa et prepostere: voluta in Campani interpretatione: ordinata digesta et castigata sunt. Quibus etiam nonnulla ab illo venerando. Socratico philosopho mirando iudicio structa habentur adiuncta. Deputatum scilicet Euclidi volumen. xiiij. cum expositione Hypsi. Alex. Itidemque et Phaeno. Specu. et Perspe. cum expositione Theonis. ac mirandus ille liber Datorum cum expositione Pappi Mechanici vna cum Marini dialectici protheoria. Bar. Zamber. Uene. Interprete. Cum grat¯ıa et Priuilegio per decennium.
colophon: Impressum Venetiis fœlicibus auibus opus est huiusmodi aureum & rarissimum: in ædibus Ioannis Tacuini librarii accuratissima dilligentia recognitum. Anno reconciliatæ diuinitatis .M.D.X. VII. Klendas Aprilis. Auspiciis fœlicissimæ Venetorum. Re. Pu. Leonardi Lauredani: Principis sapientissimi: Cautum est tamen dominii sanc-tione: ne quis presens opus Venetiis cudat: aut alibi impressum uendere audeat: mulcta adiuncta ut in Priui. pressius legitur.
title_EN: Euclidis Megarensis, the Platonic philosopher, the Janitor of Mathematical disciplines: In this volume, those who aspire to the substance of mathematics will find: thirteen books of the Elements, with the exposition of Theon, the distinguished mathematician. Many things that were missing have been added, taken from the Greek reading, and not only many things overturned and preposterously: turned in Campanus' interpretation: they have been ordered, arranged, and corrected. To which also some things constructed by that venerable Socratic philosopher with admirable judgment are attached. Namely, the fourteenth volume assigned to Euclid, with the exposition of Hypsicles of Alexandria. Likewise, Phaenomena, Specularia, and Perspectiva, with the exposition of Theon. And that marvelous book of Data with the exposition of Pappus the Mechanic, together with the protheoria of Marinus the Dialectician. Bartholomew Zamberti of Venice, Interpreter. With grace and privilege for a decade.
colophon_EN: Impressum in Venice under auspicious signs, this golden and most rare work: in the house of Ioannis Tacuinus, bookseller, reviewed with the most accurate diligence. In the year of reconciled divinity 1510, on the seventh day before the Kalends of April. Under the auspices of the most fortunate Venetian Republic, Leonardo Loredan: the wisest prince: It is nevertheless decreed by the sanction of the dominion: that no one may print the present work in Venice: or dare to sell it printed elsewhere: under penalty as more precisely read in the Privilege.

title:
CONTENTA. EVCLIDIS Megarensis Geometricorum el-ementorum libri XV. CAMPANI Galli transalpini in eosdem commentariorum libri XV. THEONIS Alexandrini Bartholamæo Zamberto Veneto interprete, in tredecim priores, commentariorum libri XIII. HYPSICLIS Alexandrini in duos posteriores, eodem Bartholamæo Zamberto Veneto interprete, commentariorum libri
II. VTCVNQVE NOSTER VALVIT LABOR conciliata sunt hæc omnia, ad studiosorum non paruam (quam optamus) vtilitatem: id Magnifico D. FRANCISCO Briconneto postulante. Si hæc beneuole suscipiantur, & fructum adferant quem cupimus: alia eiusdem authoris opera prodibunt in lucem, successum præstante deo, & adiutoribus (vbivbi gentium sint) ad bonarum literarum institutionem probe affectis Gallis, Italis, Germanis, Hispanis, Anglis. quibus omnibus prospera imprecamur: & puram pro dignitate veramque cognitionis lucem.
colophon:
EVCLIDIS MEGARENSIS CLARISSIMI PHIlosophi
Mathematicorumque facile principis, primum ex Campani, deinde
ex Theonis in priores tredecim, & Hypsiclis Alexandrini in duos posteriores, Graecorum philosophorum traditionibus, Bartholamæo Zamberto Veneto interprete: geometricorum Elementorum librorum quindecim. Finis.
imprint: PARISIIS in oicina Henrici Stephani e regione scholæ Decretorum.
title_EN: CONTENT. EVCLIDIS of Megara's fifteen books of geometric elements. CAMPANUS of Gallia Transalpina's fifteen books of commentary on the same. THEON of Alexandria, interpreted by Bartholomew Zamberto of Venice, thirteen books of commentary on the first thirteen. HYPSICLES of Alexandria, on the last two, interpreted by the same Bartholomew Zamberto of Venice, two books of commentary. HOWEVER OUR LABOR HAS BEEN WORTHWHILE, all these have been compiled for the not insignificant (we hope) benefit of students: at the request of the Magnificent D. FRANCISCO Briconneto. If these are received kindly, and bring the fruit we desire: other works of the same author will come to light, with the success granted by God, and with the help of those (wherever they may be) well-disposed towards the establishment of good letters, whether they be French, Italians, Germans, Spaniards, or English. To all of whom we wish prosperity: and a pure and true light of knowledge worthy of their dignity.
colophon_EN:
EUCLID OF MEGARA, THE MOST ILLUSTRIOUS PHILOSOPHER
and easily the foremost of mathematicians, first from Campanus, then
from Theon in the first thirteen, & Hypsicles of Alexandria in the last two, according to the traditions of Greek philosophers, with Bartholomew Zamberti of Venice as the translator: the fifteen books of the Elements of Geometry. The End.
imprint_EN: PARIS at the office of Henri Estienne across from the School of Decrees.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: EVCLIDIS Megarensis Geometricorum el-ementorum libri XV.
TITLE: PATRON REF: id Magnifico D. FRANCISCO Briconneto postulante.
TITLE: EDITION INFO: VTCVNQVE NOSTER VALVIT LABOR conciliata sunt hæc omnia, ad studiosorum non paruam (quam optamus) vtilitatem
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: CAMPANI Galli transalpini in eosdem commentariorum libri XV.

OTHER NAMES: EVCLIDIS Megarensis, CAMPANI Galli transalpini, THEONIS Alexandrini, HYPSICLIS Alexandrini

title_EN: EUCLID OF MEGARA, THE MOST FAMOUS MATHEMATICIAN, GEOMETRIC ELEMENTS. Book XV. With the exposition of THEON on the first XIII translated into Latin by Bartholomew of Venice, CAMPANUS on all, & HYPSICLES of Alexandria on the last two. Added to these are the Phenomena, Catoptrics & Optics, then the Protheoria of Marinus & Data, and finally, the Treatise on the Light and the Heavy, hitherto unseen, by the same author.

title:
EVCLIDE MEGARENSE PHILOSOPHO: SOLO INTROD-VTTORE DELLE SCIENTIE MATHEMATICE: DILIGENTE-MENTE REASSETTATO, ET ALLA INTEGRITA RIDOTTO
PER IL DEGNO Professore di tal Scientie Nicolo Tartalea, BRISCIANO, Secondo le due Tradottioni: E PER COMMVNE COMMODO & vtilita di latino in volgar tradotto. CON VNA AMPLA  ESPOSITIONE  DELLO  ISTESSO  TRADOTTORE  DI
NOVO AGGIONTA. Talmente chiara, che ogni mediocre ingegno, senza la notitia, ouer suffragio di alcun’altra scientia con facilita, sera capace à poterlo intendere.
colophon: Stampato in Vinegia per Venturino Roinelli ad instantia e requisitione de Guilielmo de Monferra, & de Pietro di Facolo da Vinegia libraro, & de Nicolo Tartalea Brisciano Tradottore: Nel Mese di Febraro. Anno di nostra salute M. D. XLIII.
title_EN:
EVCLIDE MEGARENSE PHILOSOPHER: SOLE INTRODUCER OF MATHEMATICAL SCIENCES: DILIGENTLY REASSEMBLED, AND RESTORED TO INTEGRITY
BY THE WORTHY Professor of such Sciences Nicolo Tartalea, FROM BRESCIA, According to the two Translations: AND FOR COMMON BENEFIT & utility translated from Latin into the vernacular. WITH A BROAD EXPLANATION BY THE SAME TRANSLATOR NEWLY ADDED. So clear, that any average intellect, without the knowledge, or support of any other science, will easily be able to understand it.
colophon_EN: Printed in Venice by Venturino Roinelli at the request and requirement of Guilielmo de Monferra, & of Pietro di Facolo from Venice, bookseller, & of Nicolo Tartalea Brisciano, Translator: In the Month of February. Year of our salvation M. D. XLIII.

title:
ANITII MANLII SEVERINI BOETHI IN OMNIBVS PHILO-
SOPHIAE PARTIBVS INTER LAtinos & Græcos autores principis OPERA, quæ extant, omnia, non solum liberalium disciplinarum, sed maiorum facultatum studiosis etiam utilissima. sine quibus Aristoteles in præcipuis locis intellegi non potest. Quare summi uiri rectè censebant, uerè studiosum non esse in cuius bibliotheca hic autor non erat. Porrò, infinitis locis non aliquot uoces, sed longas periodos quæ in prioribus æditionibus desiderabantur, emendauimus, adiuti praesidio uetustissimorum manuscriptorum exemplarium, & auxilio doctissimorum uirorum: Inter quos in omni literarum genere summus uir HENRICHVS LORITVS GLAREANVS Arithmeticam & Musicam demonstrationibus & figuris auctiorem redditam suo pristino nitori restituit, cui exemplar aureum uenerandæque uetustatis fuit ex monasterio S. Georgij. Et MARTIANVS ROTA opus de tota differendi ratione, hoc est, organum, Dialecticæ & Rhetoricæ studiosis necessarium, illustrauit. Et huius autoris uitam certis coniecturis, cum ex alijs, tum ex Boëthi monumentis collectam, bona fide descripsit.
colophon: BASILEAE PER HENRICHVM PETRVM MENSE MARTIO. ANNO M. D. XLVI.
imprint: BASILEAE APVD HENRICHVM PETRVM.
title_EN: THE WORKS OF ANICIUS MANLIUS SEVERINUS BOETHIUS, THE FOREMOST AUTHOR IN ALL PARTS OF PHILOSOPHY AMONG LATIN AND GREEK AUTHORS, which are extant, all of them, not only most useful to students of the liberal disciplines, but also to those of the higher faculties. Without which, Aristotle cannot be understood in the principal places. Therefore, the greatest men rightly judged that one was not truly a student in whose library this author was not present. Furthermore, in countless places, we have corrected not just some words, but long periods that were missing in previous editions, aided by the support of the oldest manuscript copies, and the assistance of the most learned men: Among whom, in every kind of literature, the greatest man HENRICHUS LORITUS GLAREANUS restored Arithmetic and Music, made more complete with demonstrations and figures, to their former splendor, for which an exemplar of golden and venerable antiquity was from the monastery of St. George. And MARTIANUS ROTA illustrated the work on the entire method of differentiating, that is, the organ, necessary for students of Dialectic and Rhetoric. And he faithfully described the life of this author, collected with certain conjectures, both from others and from Boethius's own monuments.
colophon_EN: BASLE BY HENRY PETER IN THE MONTH OF MARCH. YEAR 1546.
imprint_EN: BASLE WITH HENRY PETER.

title_EN: EVCLIDIS of Megara, an EXCELLENT Philosopher & Mathematician, THE FIRST SIX BOOKS, ON Geometric principles, in Greek & Latin, together with the demonstrations of propositions, without the use of letters, true and proper, & with some others, concerning their use, added not without the greatest benefit to the students of this art. title: Das sibend, acht und neünt büch, des hochberümbten Mathematici Euclidis Megarensis, in welchen der operationen vnnd regulen aller gemainer rechnung, vrsach grund vnd fundament, angezaigt wirt, zü gefallen allen den, so die kunst der Rechnung liebhaben, durch Mag-istrum Johann Scheybl, der löblichen vniuersitet zü Tübingen des Eu-clidis vnd Arithmetic Ordinarien, auß dem latein ins teütsch gebracht, vnnd mit gemainen exemplen also illustrirt vnnd an tag geben, das sy ein yeder gemainer Rechner leichtlich verstehn, vnnd jme nutz machen kan.
colophon: Getrückt in der Kaiserlichen Reichsstat Augspurg, durch Valentin Ottmar, am zehenden tag Aprilis, im tausent fünffhundert vnd im fünffvndfünfftzigisten Jar.
imprint: Mit Römischer Künigklicher Maiestat gnade vnd freyhait, in sechs jaren nit nachzütrucken. 1555.
title_EN: The seventh, eighth, and ninth book, of the highly renowned Mathematician Euclid of Megara, in which the operations and rules of all common calculations, cause, reason, and foundation, are shown, to please all those who love the art of calculation, by Master Johann Scheybl, of the honorable university of Tübingen, the ordinary of Euclid and Arithmetic, translated from Latin into German, and thus illustrated with common examples and published, so that every common calculator can easily understand and make use of it.
colophon_EN: Printed in the Imperial City of Augsburg, by Valentin Ottmar, on the tenth day of April, in the year one thousand five hundred and fifty-five.
imprint_EN: With Roman Royal Majesty's grace and freedom, not to be reprinted for six years. 1555.

title: Die Sechs Erste Bücher Euclidis, Vom anfang oder grund der Geometrj. In welchen der rechte grund, nitt allain der Geometrj (versteh alles kunstlichen, gwisen, vnd vortailigen gebrauchs des Zirckels, Linials oder Richtscheittes vnd andrer werckzeüge, so zü allerlaj abmessen dienstlich) sonder auch der fürnemsten stuck vnd vortail der Rechenkhunst, furgeschriben vnd dargethon ist. Auß Griechischer sprach in die Teütsch gebracht, aigenttlich erklärt, Auch mit verstentlichen Exempeln, gründlichen Figurn, vnd allerlaj den nutz füraugen stellenden Anhängen geziert, Dermassen vormals in Teütscher sprach nie gesehen worden. Alles zü lieb vnd gebrauch den Kunstliebenden Teütschen, so sych der Geometrj vnd Rechenkunst anmassen, mit vilfältiger mühe vnd arbait zum trewlichsten erarnet, vnd in Truckh gegeben, Durch Wilhelm Holtzman, genant Xylander, von Augspurg.
colophon: Vollendet durch Iacob Kündig, zü Basel, in Ioanns Oporini kosten, im jar 1562. auff den dreyßigsten tag des Winmonats.
imprint: Getruckht zü Basel.
title_EN: The Six First Books of Euclid, From the beginning or foundation of Geometry. In which the true foundation, not only of Geometry (understand all artificial, certain, and advantageous use of the compass, ruler or straightedge, and other tools, which are useful for all kinds of measurement) but also of the principal parts and advantages of arithmetic, is prescribed and demonstrated. Translated from the Greek language into German, properly explained, Also adorned with understandable examples, thorough figures, and all kinds of appendices presenting the utility, In a manner never before seen in the German language. All for the love and use of the art-loving Germans, who take up Geometry and arithmetic, earned with much effort and work most faithfully, and given in print, By Wilhelm Holtzman, called Xylander, from Augsburg.
colophon_EN: Completed by Iacob Kündig, at Basel, at the expense of Ioanns Oporini, in the year 1562, on the thirtieth day of the wine month.
imprint_EN: Arrived in Basel.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: In welchen der rechte grund, nitt allain der Geometrj (versteh alles kunstlichen, gwisen, vnd vortailigen gebrauchs des Zirckels, Linials oder Richtscheittes vnd andrer werckzeüge, so zü allerlaj abmessen dienstlich) sonder auch der fürnemsten stuck vnd vortail der Rechenkhunst, furgeschriben vnd dargethon ist. Auß Griechischer sprach in die Teütsch gebracht, aigenttlich erklärt

title:
ARITHMETICES  EVCLIDEAE  LIBER  PRIMVS.  Aliâs  in
ordine reliquorum SEPTIMVS: Qui citra præcedentium Sex librorum Geometricorum opem eruditè persequitur, cum reliquis duobus sequentibus, uera principia ac solidiora fundamenta Logistices, id est, ut uocant, Arithmetices Practicæ. Per Ioan. Sthen. Luneb. IN SCHOLARVM VSVM κατa τo oτι tractatus Eρωτη[lατικhς, disquisi-tione nimirum Dialectica quæ Dialogorum est propria.
title_EN:
THE FIRST BOOK OF EUCLIDEAN ARITHMETIC. Otherwise in
the order of the remaining SEVENTH: Which, without the aid of the preceding Six books of Geometry, skillfully pursues, along with the other two following, the true principles and more solid foundations of Logistics, that is, as they call it, Practical Arithmetic. By Ioan. Sthen. Luneb. FOR THE USE OF SCHOOLS κατa τo oτι treatise Eρωτη[lατικhς, with a Dialectical inquiry which is proper to Dialogues.

author (normalized): François de Foix, Comte de Candalle
title:
EVCLIDIS MEGARENSIS MATHEMATICI CLARISSIMI ELEMENTA  GEOMETRICA,  LIBRIS  XV.  AD  GERMANAM
GEOMETRIAE INTELligentiam è diuersis lapsibus temporis iniuria contractis restituta, adimpletis præter maiorum spem, quæ hactenus deerant, solidorum regularium conferentiis ac inscriptionibus. His accessit decimus sextus liber, de solidorum regularium sibi inuicem inscriptorum collationibus, tum etiam cœptum opusculum de Com-positis regularibus solidis planè peragendum. AVTHORE Francisco Flussate Candalla. AD Carolum IX. Christianissimum Galliarum Regem.
imprint: PARISIIS, Apud Iohannem Royerium typographum Regium. Ex iussu & priuilegio Regis. 1566.
title_EN: THE ELEMENTS OF GEOMETRY BY THE MOST FAMOUS MATHEMATICIAN EUCLID OF MEGARA, IN FIFTEEN BOOKS. RESTORED TO THE TRUE UNDERSTANDING OF GEOMETRY FROM VARIOUS ERRORS CONTRACTED THROUGH THE INJURY OF TIME, WITH ADDITIONS BEYOND THE EXPECTATION OF THE ELDERS, WHICH HAVE HITHERTO BEEN LACKING, OF THE COMPARISONS AND INSCRIPTIONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS. TO THIS IS ADDED A SIXTEENTH BOOK, ON THE COMPARISONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS INSCRIBED WITHIN EACH OTHER, AND ALSO A BEGUN WORK ON THE COMPLETION OF REGULAR COMPOSITE SOLIDS. BY THE AUTHOR Francis Flussate Candalla. TO Charles IX, THE MOST CHRISTIAN KING OF THE FRANKS.
imprint_EN: PARIS, At John Royer, Royal Printer. By order & privilege of the King. 1566.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: EVCLIDIS MEGARENSIS MATHEMATICI CLARISSIMI ELEMENTA GEOMETRICA, LIBRIS XV.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: AD GERMANAM GEOMETRIAE INTELligentiam è diuersis lapsibus temporis iniuria contractis restituta, adimpletis præter maiorum spem, quæ hactenus deerant, solidorum regularium conferentiis ac inscriptionibus.
TITLE: PATRON REF: AD Carolum IX. Christianissimum Galliarum Regem.
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: His accessit decimus sextus liber, de solidorum regularium sibi inuicem inscriptorum collationibus, tum etiam cœptum opusculum de Com-positis regularibus solidis planè peragendum.

title:
ANITII MANLII SEVERINI BOETHI, PHILOSOPHORVM
ET THEOLOGORVM PRINCIPIS OPERA omnia, quorum alia antè impressa, nunc denuò per doctos uiros recognita: alia, quæ hactenus latuerunt, nunc primùm emendatiss. in lucem prodeunt. In quibus præter uniuersæ philosophiæ exactissimam doctrinam, pluri-morum in diuinis mysteriorum, & diiciliorum locorum in Platone, Aristotele alijsque Græcis & Latinis autoribus luculentissimæ expli-cationes reperiuntur. PRAETEREA IAM ACCESSERVNT, Ioannis Murmelij in v. Lib. De Consolatione Philosophiæ commentaria. Et in eosdem Rodolphi Agricolæ Enarrationes. Item, Gilberti Porretæ, Episcopi Pictauiensis in IIII. Lib. de Trinitate commentarij, antè nun-quam æditi.  Præter reliquos doctiss. uiros, HENRICVS LORITVS
GLAREANVS, Arithmeticam & Musicam demonstrationibus & figuris auctiorem redditam, suo pristino nitori restituit: Cui exemplar aureum uenerandæque uetustatis fuit ex monasterio S. Georgij. Et MAR-TIANVS ROTA, opus de tota differendi ratione, hoc est, organum, Dialecticæ & Rhetoricæ studiosis necessarium, illustrauit. Et huius autoris uitam, cùm ex alijs, tum ex Boëthi munumentis collectam, bona fide descripsit.
colophon: BASILEAE, EX OFFICINA HENRICPETRINA, MENSE MARTIO, ANNO M D LXX.
imprint: Cum Cæs. Maiest. Gratia & Priuilegio. BASILEAE, EX OFFICINA HENRICPETRINA.
title_EN:
THE COMPLETE WORKS OF ANICIUS MANLIUS SEVERINUS BOETHIUS, PRINCE OF PHILOSOPHERS
AND THEOLOGIANS, some of which were previously printed, now newly reviewed by learned men: others, which have remained hidden until now, are now for the first time published in a most corrected form. In which, besides the most exact doctrine of universal philosophy, the most splendid explanations of many divine mysteries, and the more difficult passages in Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek and Latin authors are found. FURTHERMORE, THERE HAVE NOW BEEN ADDED, the commentaries of Johannes Murmelius on the five books of The Consolation of Philosophy. And the Explanations on the same by Rodolphus Agricola. Also, the commentaries of Gilbert Porreta, Bishop of Poitiers, on the four books on the Trinity, never before published. Besides other most learned men, HENRICUS LORITUS
GLAREANUS, has restored Arithmetic and Music, made more complete with demonstrations and figures, to their former splendor: For whom a golden example of venerable antiquity was from the monastery of St. George. And MARTIANUS ROTA, has illustrated the work on the entire method of differentiating, that is, the organ, necessary for students of Dialectics and Rhetoric. And he has faithfully described the life of this author, collected from both other sources and Boethius's own monuments.
colophon_EN: BASLE, FROM THE HENRICPETRINA PRESS, IN THE MONTH OF MARCH, YEAR 1570.
imprint_EN: With the Grace & Privilege of the Imperial Majesty. BASEL, FROM THE HENRICPETRINA PRESS.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: ANITII MANLII SEVERINI BOETHI, PHILOSOPHORVM ET THEOLOGORVM PRINCIPIS OPERA omnia
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: quorum alia antè impressa, nunc denuò per doctos uiros recognita: alia, quæ hactenus latuerunt, nunc primùm emendatiss. in lucem prodeunt.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC 2: In quibus præter uniuersæ philosophiæ exactissimam doctrinam, pluri-morum in diuinis mysteriorum, & diiciliorum locorum in Platone, Aristotele alijsque Græcis & Latinis autoribus luculentissimæ expli-cationes reperiuntur.
TITLE: EDITION INFO: quorum alia antè impressa, nunc denuò per doctos uiros recognita: alia, quæ hactenus latuerunt, nunc primùm emendatiss. in lucem prodeunt.
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: PRAETEREA IAM ACCESSERVNT, Ioannis Murmelij in v. Lib. De Consolatione Philosophiæ commentaria. Et in eosdem Rodolphi Agricolæ Enarrationes. Item, Gilberti Porretæ, Episcopi Pictauiensis in IIII. Lib. de Trinitate commentarij, antè nun-quam æditi.
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT 2: Præter reliquos doctiss. uiros, HENRICVS LORITVS GLAREANVS, Arithmeticam & Musicam demonstrationibus & figuris auctiorem redditam, suo pristino nitori restituit: Cui exemplar aureum uenerandæque uetustatis fuit ex monasterio S. Georgij. Et MAR-TIANVS ROTA, opus de tota differendi ratione, hoc est, organum, Dialecticæ & Rhetoricæ studiosis necessarium, illustrauit. Et huius autoris uitam, cùm ex alijs, tum ex Boëthi munumentis collectam, bona fide descripsit.

author (normalized): François de Foix, Comte de Candalle
title:
EVCLIDIS MEGARENSIS MATHEMATICI CLARISSIMI ELEMENTA, LIBRIS XV. AD GERMANAM GEOmetriæ intel-
ligentiam è diuersis lapsibus temporis iniuria contractis restituta, Adimpletis præter maiorum spem, quæ hactenus deerant, solidorum regularium conferentiis ac inscriptionibus. Accessit decimussextus liber, de solidorum regularium sibi inuicem inscriptorum collationibus. Nouissimè collati sunt decimusseptimus & decimusoctauus, priori edi-tione quodammodo polliciti, de componendorum, inscribendorum, & conferendorum compositorum solidorum inuentis, ordine & numero absoluti. AVTHORE D. Francisco Flussate Candalla. AD CAROLVM
IX. CHRISTIANISSIMVM GALLIARVM REGEM.
colophon: LVGDVNI, EX OFFICINA IOANNIS TORNÆSII, TYPOGRAPHI REGII. M. D. LXXVIII.
imprint: LVTETIÆ, APVD IACOBVM DV PVYS. M. D. LXXVIII.
title_EN: THE ELEMENTS OF EUCLID OF MEGARA, THE MOST FAMOUS MATHEMATICIAN, IN FIFTEEN BOOKS. RESTORED TO THE TRUE UNDERSTANDING OF GEOMETRY FROM VARIOUS ERRORS CONTRACTED BY THE INJURY OF TIME, WITH ADDITIONS BEYOND THE EXPECTATION OF THE ANCIENTS, WHICH HAVE HITHERTO BEEN LACKING, OF THE DISCUSSIONS AND INSCRIPTIONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS. A SIXTEENTH BOOK HAS BEEN ADDED, ON THE COMPARISONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS INSCRIBED WITHIN EACH OTHER. RECENTLY, THE SEVENTEENTH AND EIGHTEENTH HAVE BEEN ADDED, IN SOME WAY PROMISED IN THE PREVIOUS EDITION, ON THE INVENTIONS, ORDER, AND NUMBER OF COMPOSITE SOLIDS TO BE COMPOSED, INSCRIBED, AND COMPARED. BY THE AUTHOR D. Francisco Flussate Candalla. TO CHARLES IX, THE MOST CHRISTIAN KING OF THE FRANKS.
colophon_EN: LYONS, FROM THE WORKSHOP OF IOANNIS TORNÆSIUS, ROYAL PRINTER. 1578.
imprint_EN: LUTETIAE, AT JACOBUM DU PUYS. 1578.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: EVCLIDIS MEGARENSIS MATHEMATICI CLARISSIMI ELEMENTA, LIBRIS XV.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: AD GERMANAM GEOmetriæ intelligentiam è diuersis lapsibus temporis iniuria contractis restituta, Adimpletis præter maiorum spem, quæ hactenus deerant, solidorum regularium conferentiis ac inscriptionibus.
TITLE: PATRON REF: AD CAROLVM IX. CHRISTIANISSIMVM GALLIARVM REGEM.

title:
EVCLIDE MEGARENSE ACVTISSIMO PHILOSOPHO SOLO INTRODVTTORE DELLE SCIENTIE MATHEMATICE.
DILIGENTEMENTE RASSETTATO, & alla integrità ridotto, per il degno professore di tal Scientie Nicolò Tartalea Brisciano. SECONDO LE  DVE  TRADOTTIONI.  CON  VNA  AMPLA  ESPOSITIONE
DELLO ISTESSO tradottore di nuouo aggionta, talmente chiara, che ogni mediocre ingegno, senza la notitia, ouer suffragio di alcun’altra scientia con facilità serà capace a poterlo intendere. Di nuouo con ogni diligenza ben corretto, e ristampato.
imprint: IN VENETIA, Appresso gli Heredi di Troian Nauo, alla libraria dal Lione. M D LXXXV.
title_EN:
EUCLID OF MEGARA, THE MOST ACUTE PHILOSOPHER, THE ONLY INTRODUCER OF MATHEMATICAL SCIENCES.
DILIGENTLY ARRANGED, & restored to integrity, by the worthy professor of such Sciences Nicolò Tartaglia of Brescia. ACCORDING TO THE TWO TRANSLATIONS. WITH A BROAD EXPOSITION
BY THE SAME translator newly added, so clear, that any average intellect, without the knowledge, or support of any other science, will easily be able to understand it. Newly corrected with every diligence, and reprinted.
imprint_EN: IN VENICE, At the Heirs of Troian Nauo, at the Lion's bookstore. 1585.

title:
LES
ELEMENS 
DE LA GEOMETRIE 
D’EVCLIDES MEGARIEN. 
Traduits & restitués à leur ancienne breueté, selon 
l’ordre de Theon. Auxquels ont esté adioustez 
les quatorze & quinziesme d’Ipsicles 
Alexandrien. 
Le tout par DOVNOT DE BAR-LE-DVC, Docteur 
ès Droicts, & Professeur en la diuine Mathematique 
aux Academies du Roy.
imprint: A PARIS, Chez IACQVES LE ROY, à l’Esperance deuant le College de Cambray. C I D I C C. I X.
title_EN:
THE
ELEMENTS
OF GEOMETRY
OF EUCLID OF MEGARA.
Translated & restored to their ancient brevity, according
to the order of Theon. To which have been added
the fourteenth & fifteenth of Ipsicles
of Alexandria.
All by DOVNOT OF BAR-LE-DUC, Doctor
of Laws, & Professor in the divine Mathematics
at the King's Academies.
imprint_EN: IN PARIS, At JACQUES LE ROY, at the Hope before the College of Cambray. C I D I C C. I X.

author (normalized): François de Foix, Comte de Candalle
title:
EVCLIDIS MEGARENSIS MATHEMATICI CLARISSIMI ELEMENTA, LIBRIS XV. AD GERMANAM GEOMETRIAE INTELLIGENTIAM, E DIVERSIS LAPSIBVS TEMPORIS INIVRIA CONTRACTIS RESTITUTA, ADIMPLETIS PRAETER
MAIORVM SPEM, QUAE HACTEnus deerant, solidorum regu-larium conferentijs ac inscriptionibus. Accessit decimussextus liber, ac solidorum regularium sibi inuicem inscriptorum collationibus. Nouissimè collati sunt decimusseptimus & decimusoctauus, priori editioni quodammodo polliciti, de componendorum, inscribendo-rum, & conferendorum compositorum solidorum inuentis, ordine & numero absoluti. AVTHORE D. FRANCISCO FLVSSATE CAN-DALLA. AD CAROLVM IX. CHRISTIANISSIMVM GALLIARVM
REGEM.
colophon: LVGDVNI, EX OFFICINA IOANNIS TORNÆSII, TYPOGRAPHI REGII. M. D. LXXVIII.
imprint: COLONIAE VBIORVM, ANNO 1602.
title_EN: THE ELEMENTS OF EUCLID OF MEGARA, THE MOST FAMOUS MATHEMATICIAN, IN FIFTEEN BOOKS. RESTORED TO THE TRUE UNDERSTANDING OF GEOMETRY, FROM VARIOUS ERRORS CONTRACTED THROUGH THE INJURY OF TIME, FULFILLED BEYOND THE HOPE OF THE ANCIENTS, WITH THE ADDITION OF THE COMPARISONS AND INSCRIPTIONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS WHICH WERE HITHERTO LACKING. THE SIXTEENTH BOOK HAS BEEN ADDED, WITH COMPARISONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS INSCRIBED WITHIN EACH OTHER. MOST RECENTLY, THE SEVENTEENTH AND EIGHTEENTH HAVE BEEN ADDED, IN SOME WAY PROMISED IN THE PRIOR EDITION, COMPLETED IN ORDER AND NUMBER, ON THE INVENTIONS OF COMPOSING, INSCRIBING, AND COMPARING COMPOSITE SOLIDS. BY THE AUTHOR D. FRANCISCO FLUSSATE CANDALLA. TO CHARLES IX, THE MOST CHRISTIAN KING OF THE FRENCH.
colophon_EN: LYONS, FROM THE WORKSHOP OF IOANNIS TORNÆSIUS, ROYAL PRINTER. 1578.
imprint_EN: COLOGNE, IN THE YEAR 1602.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: EVCLIDIS MEGARENSIS MATHEMATICI CLARISSIMI ELEMENTA, LIBRIS XV.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: AD GERMANAM GEOMETRIAE INTELLIGENTIAM, E DIVERSIS LAPSIBVS TEMPORIS INIVRIA CONTRACTIS RESTITUTA, ADIMPLETIS PRAETER MAIORVM SPEM, QUAE HACTEnus deerant, solidorum regu-larium conferentijs ac inscriptionibus.
TITLE: PATRON REF: AD CAROLVM IX. CHRISTIANISSIMVM GALLIARVM REGEM.

title_EN: THE ELEMENTS OF EUCLID OF MEGARA, A MOST ILLUSTRIOUS MATHEMATICIAN, IN FIFTEEN BOOKS. RESTORED TO THE TRUE UNDERSTANDING OF GEOMETRY, FROM VARIOUS ERRORS CONTRACTED THROUGH THE INJURY OF TIME, FULFILLED BEYOND THE HOPE OF OUR ANCESTORS, WITH THE ADDITION OF WHAT WAS HITHERTO LACKING, THE COMPARISONS AND INSCRIPTIONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS. A SIXTEENTH BOOK HAS BEEN ADDED, WITH COMPARISONS OF REGULAR SOLIDS INSCRIBED WITHIN EACH OTHER. RECENTLY, THE SEVENTEENTH AND EIGHTEENTH HAVE BEEN ADDED, IN SOME WAY PROMISED IN THE EARLIER EDITION, COMPLETED IN ORDER AND NUMBER ON THE INVENTIONS OF COMPOSING, INSCRIBING, AND COMPARING COMPOSITE SOLIDS. title: De ses eerste boucken EVCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fon-damenten der Geometri. Mitsgaders een cort byvouchsel in vvelck, ten eersten eenighe nutticheyden uyt de selve boucken verclaert vvorden: Daer nae oock de specien in Geometrische figueren, alst maken, veranderen, tsamen-voughen, af-trecken, vermenichfuldighen, ende deelen. Over-gheset, verclaert, ende uytgheleyt DOOR IAN PIETERSZOON DOV, der stadt Leyden Lantmeter ende Wijn-roeyer.
imprint: TOT LEYDEN, By Ian Bouvvensz. vvoonende opte Hooghelantsche Kerckgracht. Anno 1606.
title_EN: The first six books of EUCLID, On the principles and foundations of Geometry. Together with a short supplement in which, firstly, some utilities from the same books are explained: Thereafter also the species in Geometric figures, as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing. Translated, explained, and elucidated BY IAN PIETERSZOON DOV, Land surveyor and Wine gauger of the city of Leiden.
imprint_EN: TOT LEYDEN, By Ian Bouvvensz. residing on the Hooghelantsche Kerckgracht. Anno 1606.

title: De ses eerste Boucken EVCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fonda-menten der Geometri. VVaer by gevoecht sijn eenige nutticheden, uyt de selve Boecken ghetrocken; Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figuren, als ’tmaecken, veranderen, ’t samenvougen, aftrecken, ver-menichvuldigen, ende deelen. Overgheset, verclaert, ende uytgheleyt, tot vorderinge, ende oeffeninge, van alle leergierige, liefhebbers der selver vryer Conste, DOOR IAN PIETERSZOON DOV, der stadt Leyden Lantmeter ende Wijnroeyer.

To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books; Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing. title: Die Ersten Sechs Bücher Elementorum EVCLIDIS, In welchen die Anfäng vnd Gründe der Geometria ordenlich gelehret, vnd gründtlich erwiesen werden, Mit sonderm Fleiss vnd Mühe auss Griechischer in vnsere Hohe deutsche Sprach übergesetzet, vnd mit verständtlichen Exempeln in Linien vnd gemeinen Rational Zahlen, Auch mit Newen Figuren, auff das leichtest vnd aigentlichest erkläret: Alles zu sondern Nutzden jenigen, so sich der Geometria, im Rechnen, Kriegsswesen, Feldtmässen, Bauen, vnd andern Künsten vnnd Handtwerckern zugebrauchen haben: Auss Befehl Dess Edlen vnd Gestrengen Herrn, Hanss Philip Fuchss von Bimbach, zu Möhrn, Alten Rechenberg vnd Schwaningen, Obristen: Durch SIMONEM MARIUM Guntzenhu-sanum Franc. Fürstlichen Brandenb: bestalten Mathematicum, vnd Medicinæ Utriusq; Studiosum.
colophon:
Gedruckt zu Onoltzbach, durch Paulum Böhem, ANNO
M. D C X.
imprint: CUM PRIVILEGIO, Onoltzbach, Gedruckt durch Paulum Böhem, Im Jahr Christi, M. D C X.
title_EN: The First Six Books of EUCLID'S Elements, In which the beginnings and foundations of Geometry are orderly taught and thoroughly demonstrated, With special diligence and effort translated from Greek into our High German language, and explained with understandable examples in lines and common rational numbers, Also with new figures, in the easiest and most proper way: All for the special benefit of those who have to use Geometry in calculation, military affairs, land surveying, construction, and other arts and crafts: By order of the Noble and Honorable Lord, Hans Philip Fuchss of Bimbach, at Möhrn, Alten Rechenberg and Schwaningen, Colonel: By SIMON MARIUS of Gunzenhausen, Franconia. Appointed Mathematician of the Princely Brandenburg, and Student of both Medicine.
colophon_EN:
Printed in Onoltzbach, by Paulum Böhem, ANNO
M. D C X.
imprint_EN: WITH PRIVILEGE, Onoltzbach, Printed by Paulum Böhem, In the year of Christ, 1610.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: Die Ersten Sechs Bücher Elementorum EVCLIDIS
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: In welchen die Anfäng vnd Gründe der Geometria ordenlich gelehret, vnd gründtlich erwiesen werden
TITLE: CONTENT DESC 2: Mit sonderm Fleiss vnd Mühe auss Griechischer in vnsere Hohe deutsche Sprach übergesetzet, vnd mit verständtlichen Exempeln in Linien vnd gemeinen Rational Zahlen, Auch mit Newen Figuren, auff das leichtest vnd aigentlichest erkläret
TITLE: AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: Fürstlichen Brandenb: bestalten Mathematicum, vnd Medicinæ Utriusq; Studiosum
TITLE: PATRON REF: Auss Befehl Dess Edlen vnd Gestrengen Herrn, Hanss Philip Fuchss von Bimbach, zu Möhrn, Alten Rechenberg vnd Schwaningen, Obristen
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: Alles zu sondern Nutzden jenigen, so sich der Geometria, im Rechnen, Kriegsswesen, Feldtmässen, Bauen, vnd andern Künsten vnnd Handtwerckern zugebrauchen haben
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT 2: Auss Befehl Dess Edlen vnd Gestrengen Herrn, Hanss Philip Fuchss von Bimbach, zu Möhrn, Alten Rechenberg vnd Schwaningen, Obristen
EXPLICITLY STATED: TRANSLATED FROM: auss Griechischer in vnsere Hohe deutsche Sprach

title:
De ses eerste Boucken EVCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fondamenten der Geometrie. Waer by ghevoecht zijn eenighe nut-ticheden, uyt de selve Boecken ghetrocken; Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figueren, als ’tmaken, veranderen, ’tsamen-voughen, af-trecken, vermenichvuldighen, ende deelen. Overgeset, verclaert, ende uytgeleyt, tot vorderinghe, ende oeffeninghe, van alle leergierighe, lief
hebbers der selver vryer Conste. Door IAN PIETERSZOON DOV, der stadt Leyden Landtmeter ende Wijnroeyer. Van nieus oversien, ende verbetert: Mitsgaders de bygevouchde nutticheden mette spetien in Geometrische figueren breeder verclaert ende vermeerdert deur den selven Autheur.
imprint: TOT AMSTERDAM, By Willem Iansz. op’t Water, in de vergulde Sonnewijser. Anno 1616.
title_EN: The first six Books of EUCLID, On the principles and foundations of Geometry. To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books; Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing. Translated, explained, and interpreted, for the advancement and practice, of all curious, enthusiasts of the same liberal Art. By IAN PIETERSZOON DOV, Land Surveyor and Wine Gauger of the city of Leiden. Newly reviewed, and improved: Together with the added utilities with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and expanded by the same Author.
imprint_EN: TO AMSTERDAM, By Willem Iansz. on the Water, at the gilded Sundial. Year 1616.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: Van de beginselen ende fondamenten der Geometrie.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC 2: Waer by ghevoecht zijn eenighe nut-ticheden, uyt de selve Boecken ghetrocken; Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figueren, als ’tmaken, veranderen, ’tsamen-voughen, af-trecken, vermenichvuldighen, ende deelen.
TITLE: AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: der stadt Leyden Landtmeter ende Wijnroeyer.

title:
Die sechs ersten Bücher EVCLIDIS, Desz höchgelärten weit-berümbten, Griechischen Philosophi und Mathematici: Von den anfängen vnd fundamenten der Geometriæ. Dabey dann mancherley auss disen Büchern gezogene nutzbarkeiten angefüget seind: sampt den Speciebus inn Geometrischen figurn, als machen, verändern, zusammenfügen, abziehen, vielfältigen vnnd theilen: Per Demonstra-tiones Lineales. Auss H. Ioann Petersz Dou. Niderlandischen andern Edition verteutscht, Durch Sebastianum Curtium, Arithmeticum &
G. Verordneten Inspectorn vnd Visitatorn der Teütschen Schuln in Nurnberg.
imprint: Gedruckt zu Amsterdam bey Wilhelm Janss. 1618.
title_EN:
The first six books of EUCLID, the highly learned and renowned Greek philosopher and mathematician: On the beginnings and foundations of Geometry. Along with various utilities drawn from these books: together with the species in geometric figures, such as making, altering, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing: Through Linear Demonstrations. Translated from Mr. Ioann Petersz Dou's Dutch second edition, by Sebastian Curtius, Arithmetician &
G. Appointed Inspector and Visitor of the German Schools in Nuremberg.
imprint_EN: Printed in Amsterdam by Wilhelm Janss. 1618.

title:
ΕΥΚΛΕΙΔΟΥ ΔΕΔΟΜΕΝΑ. ΚΑΙ ΜΑΡΙΝΟΥ ΦΙΛΟΣΟΦΟΥ ΕΙΣ ΔΕΔΟΜΕΝΑ ΕΥΚΛΕΙΔΟΥ ΥΠΟΜΝΗΜΑ. EVCLIDIS
DATA. OPVS AD VETERVM GEOMETRIÆ Autorum Archimedis, Apollonij, Pappi, Eutocij, cæterorúmque non modo lectionem, sed ad Geometricæ quoque Analyseos instaurationem planè necessar-ium, & à multis diu desideratum. CLAVDIVS HARDY SEBAST. FIL. in supremâ Parisiensi Curiâ Aduocatus, è Regis Christianissimi Bibliothecâ Græcè nunc primùm edidit, Latinè vertit, scholijsq; illus-trauit. Adiectus est ex eadem Bibliothecâ MARINI PHILOSOPHI Commentarius Græcè & Latinè, quo Dati natura, Datorúmque Eu-clideorum vtilitates explicantur.
imprint:
LVTETIÆ  PARISIORVM,  Impensis  MELCHIORIS
MONDIERE, in insulæ Palatinæ vico Harlæo, ad insigne Viperarum. Anno M D C XXV. Cum Priuilegio Regis Christianissimi.
title_EN:
EUCLID'S DATA. AND MARINUS THE PHILOSOPHER'S COMMENTARY ON EUCLID'S DATA. EUCLID'S
DATA. A WORK ESSENTIAL NOT ONLY FOR THE READING OF THE ANCIENT GEOMETRY AUTHORS ARCHIMEDES, APOLLONIUS, PAPPUS, EUTOCIUS, AND OTHERS, BUT ALSO FOR THE RESTORATION OF GEOMETRIC ANALYSIS, LONG DESIRED BY MANY. CLAUDIUS HARDY, SON OF SEBASTIAN, ADVOCATE IN THE SUPREME PARISIAN COURT, HAS NOW FOR THE FIRST TIME PUBLISHED IT IN GREEK FROM THE LIBRARY OF THE MOST CHRISTIAN KING, TRANSLATED IT INTO LATIN, AND ILLUSTRATED IT WITH NOTES. APPENDED IS THE COMMENTARY OF MARINUS THE PHILOSOPHER FROM THE SAME LIBRARY IN GREEK AND LATIN, IN WHICH THE NATURE OF THE GIVEN AND THE USES OF EUCLID'S DATA ARE EXPLAINED.
imprint_EN:
LUTETIAE  OF THE PARISIANS,  At the expense of MELCHIOR
MONDIERE, in the Palatine island, Harlay street, at the sign of the Vipers. Year 1625. With the Privilege of the Most Christian King.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: OPVS AD VETERVM GEOMETRIÆ Autorum Archimedis, Apollonij, Pappi, Eutocij, cæterorúmque non modo lectionem, sed ad Geometricæ quoque Analyseos instaurationem planè necessar-ium, & à multis diu desideratum.
TITLE: AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: in supremâ Parisiensi Curiâ Aduocatus, è Regis Christianissimi Bibliothecâ Græcè nunc primùm edidit, Latinè vertit, scholijsq; illus-trauit.
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: ΚΑΙ ΜΑΡΙΝΟΥ ΦΙΛΟΣΟΦΟΥ ΕΙΣ ΔΕΔΟΜΕΝΑ ΕΥΚΛΕΙΔΟΥ ΥΠΟΜΝΗΜΑ.
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT 2: Adiectus est ex eadem Bibliothecâ MARINI PHILOSOPHI Commentarius Græcè & Latinè, quo Dati natura, Datorúmque Eu-clideorum vtilitates explicantur.

title: De ses eerste Boecken EVCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fondamenten der Geometrie. Waer by ghevoecht zijn eenighe nut-ticheden, uyt de selve Boecken ghetrocken; Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figueren, als ’tmaken, veranderen, t’samen-voeghen, af-trecken, vermenichvuldighen, ende deelen. Overgheset, verclaert, ende uytgheleyt, tot vorderinghe, ende oeffeninghe, van alle leergierighe liefhebbers der selver vryer Conste. Door IAN PIETERSZOON DOV, der stadt Leyden Landtmeter ende Wijnroeyer. Van nieus over-sien, ende verbetert: Mitsgaders de byghevoechde nutticheden, mette specien in Geometrische figueren breeder verclaert ende vermeerdert deur den selven Autheur.
imprint: TOT AMSTERDAM By Willem Iansz. Blaeuw op’t Water, in de vergulde Sonnewijser. Anno 1626.
title_EN: The first six Books of EUCLID, On the principles and foundations of Geometry. To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books; Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing. Translated, explained, and elucidated, for the advancement and practice, of all eager lovers of the same liberal Art. By JAN PIETERSZOON DOV, Land Surveyor and Wine Gauger of the city of Leiden. Newly revised, and improved: Together with the added utilities, with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and expanded by the same Author.
imprint_EN: TOT AMSTERDAM By Willem Iansz. Blaeuw on the Water, at the gilded Sundial. Anno 1626.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: De ses eerste Boecken EVCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fondamenten der Geometrie.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: Waer by ghevoecht zijn eenighe nut-ticheden, uyt de selve Boecken ghetrocken; Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figueren, als ’tmaken, veranderen, t’samen-voeghen, af-trecken, vermenichvuldighen, ende deelen.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC 2: Overgheset, verclaert, ende uytgheleyt, tot vorderinghe, ende oeffeninghe, van alle leergierighe liefhebbers der selver vryer Conste.
TITLE: AUTHOR NAME: Door IAN PIETERSZOON DOV, der stadt Leyden Landtmeter ende Wijnroeyer.
TITLE: AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: der stadt Leyden Landtmeter ende Wijnroeyer.
TITLE: EDITION INFO: Van nieus over-sien, ende verbetert: Mitsgaders de byghevoechde nutticheden, mette specien in Geometrische figueren breeder verclaert ende vermeerdert deur den selven Autheur.
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figueren, als ’tmaken, veranderen, t’samen-voeghen, af-trecken, vermenichvuldighen, ende deelen.

title:
LES QVINZE LIVRES
DES ELEMENTS 
GEOMETRIQVES
D’EVCLIDE. 
Traduicts en François par D. HENRION Professeur 
és Mathematiques, imprimez, reueus & corrigez du 
viuant de l’Autheur: auec des Commentaires 
beaucoup plus amples & faciles, & des
figures en plus grand nombre qu’en 
toutes les impreßions 
precedentes. 
Plus le Liure des DONNEZ du mesme Euclide aussi 
traduict en François par ledit Henrion, &
imprimé de son viuant.
imprint: A PARIS, De l’Imprimerie d’Isaac Dedin. Et se vendent en l’Isle du Palais, à l’Image S. Michel, par la veufue dudit Henrion. M. DC. XXXII. AVEC PRIVILEGE DV ROY.
title_EN:
THE FIFTEEN BOOKS
OF THE ELEMENTS
OF GEOMETRY
BY EUCLID.
Translated into French by D. HENRION, Professor
of Mathematics, printed, reviewed & corrected during
the lifetime of the Author: with much more extensive
& easier Commentaries, & with
a greater number of figures than in
all previous editions.
Plus the Book of DATA by the same Euclid also
translated into French by the said Henrion, &
printed during his lifetime.
imprint_EN: IN PARIS, From the Printing House of Isaac Dedin. And sold on the Isle of the Palace, at the Image of St. Michael, by the widow of the said Henrion. M. DC. XXXII. WITH ROYAL PRIVILEGE.

title: De ses eerste Boecken EVCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fondamenten der Geometrie. Waer by ghevoeght zijn eenighe nut-tigheden, uyt de selve Boecken ghetrocken; Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figueren, als ’tmaken, veranderen, t’samen-voeghen, aftrecken, vermenighvuldighen, ende deelen. Overgheset, verk-laert, ende uytgheleyt, tot vorderinghe, ende oeffeninghe, van alle leergierighe lief hebbers der selver vryer Konste. Door IAN PIETERSZ: DOU, der stadt Leyden Lant-meter ende Wijnroeyer. Van nieus oversien ende verbetert: Mitsgaders de byghevoeghde nut-tigheden, met de specien in Geometrische figueren breeder verklaert ende vermeerdert, door den selven Autheur

title_EN: The first six Books of EUCLID, On the principles and foundations of Geometry. To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books; Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing. Translated, explained, and elucidated, for the advancement and practice, of all eager lovers of the same liberal Art. By IAN PIETERSZ: DOU, land surveyor and wine gauger of the city of Leiden. Newly reviewed and improved: Together with the added utilities, with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and expanded, by the same Author.
imprint_EN: AT ROTTERDAM, By the Widow of Matthijs Basti-aensz, Book-seller, On the Steygher, In Josephus. Anno 1632.

title:
Die sechs ersten Bücher EVCLIDIS, Dess hochgelährten weit-berümbten, Griechischen Philosophi vnd Mathematici: Von den Anfängen vnd fundamenten der Geometriæ. Dabey dann mancherley auss diesen Büchern gezogene Nutzbarkeiten angefüget seind: sampt den Speciebus in Geometrischen Figuren, alss machen, verändern,
zusammenfügen, abziehen, vielfältigen vnd theilen: Per Demonstra-tiones Lineales. Auss H. Ioann Petersz Dou Niderländischen andern Edition verteutscht, Durch Sebastianum Curtium, Arithmeticum &
G. Verordneten Inspectorn vnd Visitatorn der Teuschen Schuln in Nürnberg.
imprint: Gedruckt zu Amsterdam bey Ioann Iansz. Im Jahr 1634.
title_EN:
The first six books of EUCLID, The highly learned and renowned Greek Philosopher and Mathematician: On the beginnings and foundations of Geometry. Along with various utilities drawn from these books: together with the species in geometric figures, such as making, altering, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing: Through Linear Demonstrations. Translated from Mr. Ioann Petersz Dou's Dutch second edition, By Sebastian Curtius, Arithmetician &
G. Appointed Inspector and Visitor of the German Schools in Nuremberg.
imprint_EN: Printed in Amsterdam by Ioann Iansz. In the year 1634.

title:
EVCLIDIS ELEMENTORVM GEOMETRICORVM LIBROS
TREDECIM ISIDORVM ET HYPSICLEM & Recentiores de Corporibus Regularibus, & PROCLI PROPOSITIONES GEO-METRICAS Immissionemq´ ue duarum rectarum linearum continué proportionalium inter duas rectas, tàm secundùm Antiquos, quàm se-cundùm Recentiores Geometras, nouis vbique ferè demonstrationibus illustrauit, & multis definitionibus, axiomatibus, propositionibus,
corollariis, & animaduersionibus, ad Geometriam rectè intelligen-dam necessariis, locupletauit CLAVDIVS RICHARDVS E Societate IESV Sacerdos, patria Ornacensis in libero Comitatu Burgundiæ, & Regius Mathematicarum Professor: dicauitq´ ue PHILIPPO IIII. HISPANIARVM ET INDIARVM REGI CATHOLICO.
imprint:
ANTVERPIÆ, Ex Oicina HIERONYMI VERDVSSII.
M. DC. XLV. Cum Gratiâ & Priuilegio.
title_EN:
THE THIRTEEN BOOKS OF EUCLID'S ELEMENTS OF GEOMETRY
ISIDORUS AND HYPSICLES & More Recent Authors on Regular Solids, & PROCLUS' GEOMETRIC PROPOSITIONS and the insertion of two straight lines continuously proportional between two straight lines, both according to the Ancients and according to the More Recent Geometers, have been illustrated with almost entirely new demonstrations, and enriched with many definitions, axioms, propositions, corollaries, and observations necessary for correctly understanding Geometry, by CLAUDIUS RICHARD of the Society of JESUS, Priest, native of Ornans in the free County of Burgundy, and Royal Professor of Mathematics: and dedicated to PHILIP IV, CATHOLIC KING OF SPAIN AND THE INDIES.
imprint_EN:
ANTWERP, From the Office of HIERONYMUS VERDUSSIUS.  
1645. With Grace & Privilege.

title:
De ses eerste Boecken EUCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fonda-menten der Geometrie. Waer bygevoeght zijn eenige nuttigheden, uyt de selve Boecken getrocken; Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figuren, als ’tmaken, veranderen, t’samenvoegen, aftrecken, ver-menigvuldigen ende deelen. Overgeset, verklaert, ende uytgeleyt, tot vorderinge ende oeffeninge van alle leergierige liefhebbers der selver vrye Konste. DOOR JAN PIETERSE DOU: der stadt Leyden Lant-meter ende Wijnroyer. Van nieus oversien ende verbetert: Mitsgaders
de bygevoegde nuttigheden, met de specien in Geometrische figuren breeder verklaert ende vermeerdert, door den selven Autheur.
imprint: TOT ROTTERDAM, By Pieter van Waesberghe Boeck-verkooper op’t Steygher inde swarte Klock, Anno 1647,
title_EN: The first six Books of EUCLID, On the principles and foundations of Geometry. To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books; Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying and dividing. Translated, explained, and interpreted, for the advancement and practice of all curious lovers of the same free Art. BY JAN PIETERSE DOU: Land surveyor and Wine gauger of the city of Leyden. Newly reviewed and improved: Together with the added utilities, with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and increased, by the same Author.

title: De ses eerste Boecken EUCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fonda-menten der Geometrie. Waer by-gevoeght zijn eenige nuttigheden, uyt de selve Boecken getrocken: Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figuren, als ’t maken, veranderen, t’samen-voegen, af-trecken, ver-menighvuldigen, ende deelen. Over-geset, verklaert, ende uyt-geleydt tot vorderinge ende oeffeninge van alle leer-gierige Liefhebbers der selver vrye Konste.  DOOR JAN PIETERSZ DOU, Landt-meter ende Wijn-roeyer der Stadt LEYDEN. Van nieuws oversien ende verbetert: Mitsgaders de by-gevoeghde nuttigheden, met de specien in Geometrische figuren breeder verklaert ende vermeerdert, door den selven Autheur.

title_EN: The first six Books of EUCLID, On the principles and foun-dations of Geometry. To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books: Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing. Translated, explained, and elucidated for the advancement and practice of all eager Lovers of this free Art. BY JAN PIETERSZ DOU, Land surveyor and Wine gauger of the City of LEYDEN. Newly reviewed and improved: Together with the added utilities, with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and expanded, by the same Author.
imprint_EN: TO ROTTERDAM, By Abraham van Waesberge, Bookseller on the Steyger at the crowned Lion. 1661.

title:

title_EN:
P. GASPARIS SCHOTTI REGISCURIANI OF THE SOCIETY
OF JESUS Formerly in Panormitan Sicily, now in Herbipolitan Franconia of the same SOCIETY OF JESUS Gymnasium of Mathematics Professor MATHEMATICAL COURSE, Or the Complete ENCYCLOPEDIA of all Mathematical Disciplines, Arranged in 28 Books, and organized in such a way that anyone, even with moderate talent, can learn the entire Mathematics from the very foundations by their own effort. A work long desired, promised by many, attempted by not a few, completed by none in all respects. At the end, NEW MECHANICAL THEOREMS have been added.

title:
P. GASPARIS SCHOTTI REGISCURIANI E SOCIET. JESU
Olim in Panormitano Siciliæ, nunc in Herbipolitano Franconiæ ejusdem SOCIETATIS JESU Gymnasio Matheseos Professoris CURSUS MATHEMATICUS, SIVE ABSOLUTA OMNIUM MATHEMATICARUM DISCIPLINARUM ENCYCLOPÆDIA, In
Libros XXVIII. digesta, eoque ordine disposita, ut quivis, vel mediocri præditus ingenio, totam Mathesin à primis fundamentis proprio Marte addiscere possit. Opus desideratum diu, promissum à multis, à non paucis tentatum, à nullo numeris omnibus absolutum. Accesserunt in fine THEORESES MECHANICÆ NOVÆ Additis Indicibus locupletissimis.
imprint: Cum Privilegio Sacræ Cæsareæ ac Regiæ Majestatis. FRANCOFURTI AD MOENUM, Sumptibus JOANNIS ARNOLDI CHOLINI. ANNO M DC LXXIV.
title_EN:
P. GASPARIS SCHOTTI REGISCURIANI OF THE SOCIETY OF JESUS
Formerly in the Panormitan of Sicily, now in the Herbipolitan of Franconia of the same SOCIETY OF JESUS, Professor of Mathematics in the Gymnasium MATHEMATICAL COURSE, OR COMPLETE ENCYCLOPEDIA OF ALL MATHEMATICAL DISCIPLINES, Arranged in 28 Books, and disposed in such order that anyone, even with mediocre talent, can learn the whole of Mathematics from the very foundations by their own effort. A work long desired, promised by many, attempted by not a few, completed by none in all respects. At the end, NEW MECHANICAL THEOREMS have been added, along with very comprehensive indexes.
imprint_EN:
With the Privilege of His Sacred Imperial and Royal Majesty.  
FRANKFURT AM MAIN,  
At the expense of JOHANN ARNOLD CHOLIN.  
YEAR 1674.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: CURSUS MATHEMATICUS, SIVE ABSOLUTA OMNIUM MATHEMATICARUM DISCIPLINARUM ENCYCLOPÆDIA
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: In Libros XXVIII. digesta, eoque ordine disposita, ut quivis, vel mediocri præditus ingenio, totam Mathesin à primis fundamentis proprio Marte addiscere possit.
TITLE: CONTENT DESC 2: Opus desideratum diu, promissum à multis, à non paucis tentatum, à nullo numeris omnibus absolutum.
TITLE: AUTHOR NAME: P. GASPARIS SCHOTTI REGISCURIANI E SOCIET. JESU
TITLE: AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: Olim in Panormitano Siciliæ, nunc in Herbipolitano Franconiæ ejusdem SOCIETATIS JESU Gymnasio Matheseos Professoris
TITLE: ADDITIONAL CONTENT: Accesserunt in fine THEORESES MECHANICÆ NOVÆ Additis Indicibus locupletissimis.
TITLE: VERBS: digesta, disposita, addiscere, promissum, tentatum, absolutum

title:

NOW FOR THE FIRST TIME BROUGHT TO LIGHT. Imprint: [Vol. 1] LYONS, From the ANISSONIAN Press. 1674. WITH THE KING'S PRIVILEGE.

title:
A NEW SYSTEME OF THE MATHEMATICKS: CONTAIN-ING I. ARITHMETICK, as well NATURAL and DECIMAL, as in
Species, or the Principles of ALGEBRA. II. Practical GEOMETRY, together with the first Six Books of Euclid’s ELEMENTS, as also the Eleventh and Twelfth, symbolically demonstrated. III. TRIGONOM-ETRY PLAIN and SPHERICAL. IV. COSMOGRAPHY, or a DESCRIPTION of the HEAVENS. V. NAVIGATION, or SAILING
by a Plain or Mercator’s Chart; as also by the Arch of a Great Circle, &c. VI. The DOCTRINE of the SPHERE, grounded on the Motion of the Earth, according to the Old Pythagorean and Copernican Systeme. VII. Astronomical TABLES, with Tables of Logarithms, Natural and Artificial Sines and Tangents, and Versed Sines. VIII. A New GEOGRAPHY, or a Description of the most Eminent Countries and Coasts of the WORLD, with Maps of them, and Tables of their Latitude and Longitude. Composed by Sir JONAS MOORE Knight, Late Surveyor General of His MAJESTY’S Ordnance, and Fellow of the ROYAL SOCIETY: And designed for the Use of the Royal Foundation of the Mathematical SCHOOL in CHRIST-HOSPITAL. By His MAJESTY’S special Command.
imprint: LONDON, Printed by A. Godbid and J. Playford, for ROBERT SCOTT, Bookseller in Little Britain, M. DC. LXXXI.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: A NEW SYSTEME OF THE MATHEMATICKS
TITLE: CONTENT DESC: CONTAIN-ING I. ARITHMETICK, as well NATURAL and DECIMAL, as in Species, or the Principles of ALGEBRA. II. Practical GEOMETRY, together with the first Six Books of Euclid’s ELEMENTS, as also the Eleventh and Twelfth, symbolically demonstrated. III. TRIGONOM-ETRY PLAIN and SPHERICAL. IV. COSMOGRAPHY, or a DESCRIPTION of the HEAVENS. V. NAVIGATION, or SAILING by a Plain or Mercator’s Chart; as also by the Arch of a Great Circle, &c. VI. The DOCTRINE of the SPHERE, grounded on the Motion of the Earth, according to the Old Pythagorean and Copernican Systeme. VII. Astronomical TABLES, with Tables of Logarithms, Natural and Artificial Sines and Tangents, and Versed Sines. VIII. A New GEOGRAPHY, or a Description of the most Eminent Countries and Coasts of the WORLD, with Maps of them, and Tables of their Latitude and Longitude.
TITLE: AUTHOR NAME: Composed by Sir JONAS MOORE Knight
TITLE: AUTHOR DESCRIPTION: Late Surveyor General of His MAJESTY’S Ordnance, and Fellow of the ROYAL SOCIETY
TITLE: PATRON REF: And designed for the Use of the Royal Foundation of the Mathematical SCHOOL in CHRIST-HOSPITAL. By His MAJESTY’S special Command.

title: De ses eerste Boecken EUCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fondamenten der Geometrie. Waer by-gevoeght zijn eenige nut-tigheden, uyt de selve Boecken getrocken: Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figuren, als ’t maken, veranderen, t’ samen-voegen, af-trecken, vermeenighvuldigen, ende deelen. Over-geset, verklaert, ende uyt-geleydt tot vorderinge ende oeffeninge van alle leer-gierige Liefhebbers der selver vrye Konste. DOOR JAN PIETERSZ DOU, Landt-meter ende Wijn-roeyer der Stadt LEYDEN. Desen laetsten druck, van nieuws oversien ende verbetert: Mitsgaders de by-gevoegde nuttigheden, met de specien in Geometrische figuren breeder verklaert ende vermeerdert, door den selven Autheur.
imprint: TOT ROTTERDAM. By Abraham van Waesberge, Boeck-verkooper op ’t Steyger in de gekroonde Leeuw. 1681.
title_EN: The first six Books of EUCLID, On the principles and foundations of Geometry. To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books: Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing. Translated, explained, and elucidated for the advancement and practice of all eager Lovers of the same free Art. BY JAN PIETERSZ DOU, Land surveyor and Wine gauger of the City of LEYDEN. This latest edition, newly reviewed and improved: Together with the added utilities, with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and expanded, by the same Author.
imprint_EN: TO ROTTERDAM. By Abraham van Waesberge, Bookseller at the Steyger in the crowned Lion. 1681.
TITLE: BASE CONTENT: De ses eerste Boecken EUCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fondamenten der Geometrie.

TITLE: CONTENT DESC 2: Over-geset, verklaert, ende uyt-geleydt tot vorderinge ende oeffeninge van alle leer-gierige Liefhebbers der selver vrye Konste.

Boeken, Waar by’t 16 Boek Fr. Flussatis Candallæ. Begrijpende de Beginselen, op dewelke de gantsche Wiskonst rust, Daarom ook te recht genaamt BEGINSELEN DER WISKONST. Eerst in onse nederduytse taal met alle omsightigheyd, kortheyd en klaarheyd opgesteld DOOR CLAAS JANSZ. VOOGHT Geometra, Geswooren Landmeeter en Leermeester, in de Wiskonst, als Stuurmanskonst enz. tot Amsterdam.
imprint: t’AMSTERDAM, By JOHANNES van KEULEN, Boek-en-Kaart verkoper, by de Nieuwe-Brugh, in de gekroonde Lootsman. Anno 1695. Met Privilegie voor 15 Jaren.
title_EN:
EUCLID'S ELEMENTS of GEOMETRY, Comprehended in 15
Books, Along with the 16th Book by Fr. Flussatis Candallæ. Encompassing the Principles, upon which the entire Science of Mathematics rests, Therefore rightly named PRINCIPLES OF MATHEMATICS. First composed in our Dutch language with all diligence, brevity, and clarity BY CLAAS JANSZ. VOOGHT Geometer, Sworn Land Surveyor and Teacher, in the Science of Mathematics, such as Navigation etc. at Amsterdam.
imprint_EN: AMSTERDAM, By JOHANNES van KEULEN, Book and Map seller, at the Nieuwe-Brugh, in the crowned Pilot. Year 1695. With Privilege for 15 Years.

title: Samuel Reyhers, JCti, Bey der Hoch-Fürstl. Holst. Universität Codic. und Mathematum Prof. In Teutscher Sprache vorgestellter EUCLIDES, Dessen VI. erste Bücher auf sonderbahre und sehr leichte Art, Mit Algebraischen, oder aus der neuesten Löse-Kunst entlehneten Zeichen, also dass man deroselben Beweiss auch in andern Sprachen gebrauchen kan, eingerichtet, auch des II. Buchs Vorträge nebst der gemeinen, auff Algebraische Ahrt beweisen sind.
imprint: Kiel, Druckts Joachim Reumann, Academischer Buch-drucker, bey Johann Sebastian Riecheln, Academischen Buchführer daselbst, und in Leipzig zubekommen, Im Jahr 1699.
title_EN: Samuel Reyhers, JCti, At the High-Princely Holstein University Codic. and Mathematics Prof. In German Language presented EUCLIDES, Whose first VI books in a special and very easy way, With Algebraic, or from the latest Art of Solution borrowed signs, so that one can use their proofs also in other languages, arranged, also the lectures of the II. Book together with the common, in an Algebraic manner are proven.
imprint_EN: Kiel, Printed by Joachim Reumann, Academic Book Printer, at Johann Sebastian Riecheln, Academic Bookseller there, and available in Leipzig, In the year 1699.

title: De zes eerste Boecken EUCLIDIS, Van de beginselen ende fon-damenten der Geometrie. Waer by-gevoeght zijn eenige nuttigheden, uyt deselve Boecken getroken: Mitsgaders de Specien in Geometrische figuren, als ’t maken, veranderen, t’samen voegen, aftrecken, ver-meenighvuldigen, ende deelen. Over-geset, verklaert, ende uyt-geleyt tot vorderinge ende oeffeninge van alle leer-gierige Liefhebbers der selver vrye Konste. DOOR JAN PIETERSZ. DOU, Lant-meter ende Wijn-roeyer der Stadt LEYDEN. Desen laetsten Druk, van nieuws oversien en verbetert: Mitsgaders de by-gevoegde nuttigheden, met de specien in Geometrische figuren breeder verklaert ende vermeerdert, door den selven Autheur.
imprint: t’AMSTERDAM Gedruckt, By HENDRIK BOTERENB-ROOT, Boek-verkooper op ’t Water, recht over de Nieuwe Brugh, in de Delfsche Bybel. 1700.
title_EN: The first six Books of EUCLID, On the principles and foundations of Geometry. To which are added some utilities, drawn from the same Books: Together with the Species in Geometric figures, such as making, changing, combining, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing. Translated, explained, and laid out for the advancement and practice of all eager Lovers of the same free Art. BY JAN PIETERSZ. DOU, Land-surveyor and Wine-gauger of the City of LEYDEN. This latest Edition, newly reviewed and improved: Together with the added utilities, with the species in Geometric figures more broadly explained and expanded, by the same Author.
imprint_EN: t’AMSTERDAM Printed, By HENDRIK BOTERENB-ROOT, Bookseller on the Water, directly across from the New Bridge, in the Delft Bible. 1700.
